intro: Uragoga grisebachiana, commonly known as the Grisebach's uragoga, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety purple flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has a thick, woody stem and broad, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
